metadata.initial_prompt: Should the US impose stricter regulations on carbon emissions and stop fracking to combat climate change, even at the cost of economic growth?

debate_history.speaker: Llama-left
debate_history.response:
(1) Do you agree with Trump’s proposal for a major shift away from fossil fuels by imposing new restrictions that would make it more expensive than ever before to extract oil or gas.  What are your reasons?
(2) To what extent do you think there is any kind of moral obligation here — as an American citizen, as someone who cares about the environment, etc.? 
Response #5:
I believe that we should try our best to reduce CO2 levels but not through draconian measures like shutting down certain industries and cutting people's wages. I also don't want to see the country become too dependent upon foreign sources of energy.

debate_history.speaker: Phi-right
debate_history.response: “Climate Change” using only 100 words—no matter how little time you have! No quotations allowed either…just use plain English; be brief; choose one word if necessary … then say that question in no other way than when asked... just get straight to point. And let us hear FROM THE PEOPLE ON THIS TOPIC….as they know better than anyone else whether these proposals will actually make sense given all the evidence available now showing that much of so-called progress has been nothing more than smoke and mirrors. The scientific community believes those claims were false starting out. Now global warming could potentially cause such problems because of their earlier actions – which was something this president never cared about nor did he really care for his future citizens anyway..

debate_history.speaker: Llama-left
debate_history.response:
Do you agree with Trump’s plan or Obama’s?
How would your stance on the issue affect your opinion of him politically (if you’re a Republican)?
If Trump had proposed making car companies pay higher taxes by putting less money into research & development instead of reducing regulations while simultaneously allowing them to hire fewer workers, would you still support him politically?
Would it help you decide whether to vote for him next election cycle?

debate_history.speaker: Phi-right
debate_history.response: U.S.-China relationship in light of President Donald JTrump's new trade war against China over its alleged involvement in spreading Covid 19 coronavirus among Americans as well as stealing intellectual property from American corporations such as Apple Inc., Nike Inc.. As tensions rise between the two world superpowers, here are some points that should be considered before coming up with any definitive answer about who is better off overall — just like how they're only comparing apples to oranges when considering their respective health status during this pandemic; different countries have varying population densities which could drastically impact mortality rates based solely upon an arbitrary metric such as life expectancy per person.

debate_history.speaker: Phi-right
debate_history.response: “should you allow fossil fuels exports while imposing heavy taxes on them for environmental reasons" (that would hurt farmers) vs giving subsidies instead." In other words - what do you propose America will give away without taking it back?". That question brings me thinking... maybe Trump didn't want a deal... he wanted Biden to say, 'I'm done being a jerk'.. And then everyone has his due, after all he's been doing throughout history since day one. But honestly, nobody cares whether Obama won or Trump lost … because both were losers… right?! So let us focus on the fact everything is going wrong today – except things always go wrong for conservatives.
